#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Cure the Evil Eye
#Text=The evil eye is a popular belief that somebody can voluntarily or involuntarily bring disease and disgrace to another person by looking at them , usually brought on by envy .
#Text=In some cultures , the belief is focused on children , where someone can inadvertently give a child the evil eye by complimenting them , as it draws in negative energy .
#Text=If you think you or your child is suffering from the evil eye , you can use the methods below to help diagnose and cure it .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Diagnosing the Evil Eye
#Text=Notice the symptoms .
#Text=The negative energy of an envious person can cause physical symptoms that are not related to a disease , such as weakness , eye infections , upset stomach , fever and nausea .
#Text=Also , it is likely that the affected person will have personal , family or professional problems without any apparent cause .
#Text=Follow the coal method .
#Text=This method is practiced in Eastern Europe .
#Text=Simply drop a piece of charcoal into a pan of water .
#Text=You can also use the head of a match that has burned .
#Text=Sinking is a good sign , while floating means a person or child has been affected .
#Text=Usually a parent or healer performs these rituals , if the sufferer is a child .
#Text=If not , the sufferer can perform them .
#Text=Try the wax method .
#Text=Another method is to drip hot wax into holy water .
#Text=Watch how the wax reacts .
#Text=If it splatters , it means you or the child you are testing for have the evil eye .
#Text=The same is true if it sticks to the side .
#Text=People in the Ukraine employ this method .
#Text=Try the oil method .
#Text=With this method , the person diagnosing the condition drops oil into water .
#Text=If it forms an eye , the child is thought to have the evil eye .
#Text=Another way is to pour oil over a lock of the affected person 's hair into a glass of water ( preferably holy water ) .
#Text=If the oil sinks , then the person has the evil eye .
#Text=In turn , special prayers are said until the oil does n't form an eye to cure it .
#Text=The person dropping the oil is praying for the evil eye to leave the person .
#Text=Some suggest there are special prayers for this process , which you can learn from a local healer .
#Text=Curing the Evil Eye
#Text=Try the touch method .
#Text=The easiest way to cure the evil eye , according to some , is to have the person who caused the evil eye touch the child .
#Text=Since the evil eye is usually unintentional , the person should have no problem with simply touching the child .
#Text=It does n't matter where the child is touched .
#Text=On the hand or forehead should suffice .
#Text=This belief is most prominent in Hispanic cultures .
#Text=Evil eye is supposedly caused ( sometimes ) by a person complimenting a child without touching him or her .
#Text=Use an egg .
#Text=In Mexico and Latin countries , some parents use an egg .
#Text=They pass the egg over the child 's body , commonly a prayer is said along with this such as the Our Father , and then put the egg in bowl beneath the pillow .
#Text=They leave it there during the night and check to see if the white is foggy in the morning .
#Text=If it is , the child was affected by the evil eye .
#Text=This method also cures the evil eye at the same time .
#Text=Try hand gestures .
#Text=Some say that making certain gestures with your hand can ward off or cure the evil eye .
#Text=One gesture is the mano cornuto , which is just a fist with the index and pinkie extended ( horned hand ) .
#Text=Point your hand down when making this gesture .
#Text=Another is the mano fico , where you stick your thumb in between your index finger and middle finger ( fig hand ) in a fist .
#Text=Some Italians carry a little red horn ( corna ) around by wearing it or keeping it on a key chain .
#Text=The horn is worn in place of making the horned hand sign .
#Text=Find a six-sided mirror .
#Text=One method said to cure the evil eye is the use of a mirror to reflect back bad energy .
#Text=This method is used in China .
#Text=You simply hang the mirror in a front window or on the front door .
#Text=Some people in India also use mirrors to cure or ward off evil eye .
#Text=However , instead of placing it in the home , small mirrors are sewn into clothes or worn on the body .
#Text=Use a healer .
#Text=Folk healers often provide cures for the evil eye .
#Text=If you do n't feel confident in healing the evil yourself , you can try a healer , who will perform the rituals for you .
#Text=Preventing the Evil Eye
#Text=Use a pink coral bracelet .
#Text=Some suggest that putting a pink coral bracelet on your child will help protect against the evil eye .
#Text=Others suggest having the child wear a buckeye has the same effect .
#Text=Try a red string .
#Text=In Jewish cultures , parents use a red string to fend off the evil eye .
#Text=For instance , sometimes it 's tied around a crib bar or the stroller handle .
#Text=Have the baby wear a jet amulet .
#Text=In some Hispanic cultures , babies wear an amulet made of black jet .
#Text=Often , it 's shaped as a small fist .
#Text=You may see it with red and black beads on a gold chain .
#Text=Use the spit method .
#Text=When someone gives your child a compliment , you can try spitting over your left shoulder three times and then touching wood ( or knocking your own head ) three times .
#Text=This method is most often used in Russia .
#Text=Scatter salt .
#Text=One Sicilian method of protection is to scatter salt on the floor inside the front door or outside the house .
#Text=The salt ( with innumerable grains ) is supposed to confuse evil-casters .
#Text=Another method Sicilians use is the urine method , where everyone in the house pees in a bucket .
#Text=Then the urine is spilled in front of the house .
#Text=Try an eye charm .
#Text=Many cultures use eye charms to protect against evil eye .
#Text=You can wear one on a necklace , for instance , or use one as a key chains .
#Text=In Turkey , these little charms are made out of blue glass , but other cultures make them out of other materials .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you are not sure how to cure evil eye , consult older relatives .
#Text=In many families , this knowledge has been passed down from generation to generation .
#Text=If you decide to visit a healer , witch , or shaman , make sure you are not a victim of a scam .
#Text=Ask for recommendations from your friends about whom to visit .
#Text=Quick Summary
